ResourceHeader.ResourceName: ISS Floating Potential Measurement Unit (FPMU), Summary Parameter 1 s Data

RevisionEvent.Note: Only known prior ReleaseDate of the metadata

Added PublicationInfo. Added ResourceType and NamingAuthority. Changed http to https in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Fixed version number separator in top-level schemaLocation attribute. Matched version number in schemaLocation attribute to updated value in Version tag. ZCB
Added MetadataRightsList and RightsList(s). Updated to 2.7.1. ZCB

ResourceHeader.Description: International Space Station, ISS, Floating Potential Measurement Unit, FPMU, Ionosphere Summary Wide Langmuir Probe, WLP, Density and Narrow Langmuir Probe, NLP, Temperature Records 1 s Data. The Space Dynamics Laboratory, SDL, Utah State University, USU, developed the FPMU for the NASA Johnson Space Center. The FPMU was installed by ISS Crew Members during an Extra Vehicular Activity, EVA, on the Starboard, Sl, Truss of the ISS in early August 2006. The System is based on past USU SDL Space Instruments and incorporates a Floating Potential Probe, Multiple Langmuir Probes, and a Plasma Frequency Probe into one Sensor Suite. The FPMU is used to correct the Charging Models of the Station each time a New Section is added to the Structure. By providing Feedback on the Effectiveness of Steps taken to control Charging, the FPMU helps ensure a Safe Working Environment for the Astronauts.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: R.M. Suggs, S.L. Koontz, NASA Johnson Space Center Contact Rob Suggs for support and use. Rob.Suggs@nasa.gov.

Parameter.Name: Epoch Time
Parameter.Caveats: Time, dd-mm-yyyy hh:mm:ss.mms, This parameter exhibits an increasing monotonic progression.

Parameter.Name: ISS Longitude, GEO
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: International Space Station, ISS, Longitude, Geographic, GEO

Parameter.Name: ISS Latitude, GEO
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: International Space Station, ISS, Latitude, Geographic, GEO

Parameter.Name: ISS Altitude
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: International Space Station, ISS, Altitude, Geographic, GEO

Parameter.Name: Total Ion Density
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: Total Ion Density, equal to the Electron Density
Parameter.Caveats: Ion Density derived from the FPMU Wide Langmuir Probe. It can be used also for Electron Density assuming Quasi-Neutrality

Parameter.Name: Electron Temperature
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Caveats: Electron temperature derived from the FPMU Narrow Langmuir Probe

Parameter.Name: ISS Pitch Angle
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Description: International Space Station, ISS, Pitch Angle
Parameter.Caveats: This ISS Pitch Attitude Information is necessary for Proper Derivation of the NLP Density. The NLP is a Cylindrical Langmuir Probe which is symmetric about the Roll and Yaw Axes.

Parameter.Name: Solar Illumination, Percent
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Caveats: Percent Solar Illumination with no Correction for Atmospheric Refraction

Parameter.Name: Time Code Correction
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Caveats: Flag indicating that the Time Code was Correct in Original the File, 0, or that a Corrupt Time Code was corrected during Processing, 1

Parameter.Name: Processing Ground Station
Parameter.Set: Time series defined by using: EPOCH
Parameter.Caveats: Processing Ground Station could be JSC, MSFC, or HSV.
